text: Burkina Faso competed at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships in Gwangju, South Korea from 12 to 28 July. ==Swimming== Burkina Faso entered four swimmers. ;Men {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left rowspan=2|Adama Ouedraogo |align=left|50 m freestyle |25.38 |=101 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|100 m freestyle |58.27 |109 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|Tindwende Sawadogo |align=left|50 m breaststroke |33.97 |66 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ;Women {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center; font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font- size:95%" !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align=left|Angelika Ouedraogo |align=left|50 m freestyle |29.60 |77 |colspan=4|Did not advance |- |align=left|Soukeyna Pitroipa |align=left|50 m breaststroke |44.18 |51 |colspan=4|Did not advance |} ==References== Category:Nations at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships Category:Burkina Faso at the World Aquatics Championships World Aquatics Championships
title: Burkina Faso at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships
